definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: There was no better paddler , no better steersman than my brother.
sentences.chinese: 這世上再找不到比他更好的槳手和舵手了。

sentences.english: He is the best oar in the crew.
sentences.chinese: 他是船員中最好的槳手。

sentences.english: The rowers lost their rhythm and the boat lost speed.
sentences.chinese: 槳手們划槳的節奏亂了，賽艇因此慢了下來。

sentences.english: We want to allow all paddlers the opportunity to help.
sentences.chinese: 我們想讓所有槳手的都有機會去幫助他人。

sentences.english: Mark was an oarsman and had to spend all day below deck rowing.
sentences.chinese: 馬克是槳手，一整天都要在甲板下划船。
